data.title: Unique experience
data.text: Located in basement of historic Chandler hotel.  A true southwestern speakeasy establishment.  A very comprehensive specialty drink menu.  Proceed with caution as they are very potent.  The bartenders are very personable. A special food menu very focused on appetizers.  The bruschetta selections are phenomenal.  Need to try it out.  You will not be disappointed.

data.title: Fantastic addition to downtown Chandler
data.text: The Ostrich is a speakeasy style bar immediately below Crust in downtown Chandler.  When we first walked in out of the sunny day, it was super dark.  As my eyes adjusted, I could saw cushioned booths, lounge areas and a bar.  This place is beautiful with tasteful decor. The drinks, while pricey (with no happy hour), are superb and the friendly waitress was spot on with her recommendations.  Food can be ordered and is brought down from Crust. We ordered several appetizers but our favorite was definitely the arugula and prosciutto pizza.  The music was not too loud and we able to have a conversation.  I'll definitely go back.

data.title: Quirky watering hole
data.text: Went to The Ostrich with my wife and knew it was unique when we had to go into the basement under the San Marcos Resort!  It definitely has a speak easy feel and is a great spot to have a drink or two!

data.title: Fun Place, Service and Drinks Could be Better
data.text: This place is definitely hard to find.  Look for a staircase in the back of the Crust Italian restaurant.  There's a small white staircase you head down.  The bar is dark and has a speakeasy feel but this also makes it prone to being really loud.  The service was pretty slow and getting drinks took a long time, also our waitress seemed confused about what vodkas they had and also what made up a proper martini.  Our first round of drinks was good, but the second round involved a drink called the zombie that's one of the most disgusting I've ever had.  Glad I went once, not sure I'd want to go back.

data.title: Southwestern Speakeasy
data.text: The Ostrich is an unsigned, basement level bar with only a red light bulb above the steps. A dark restaurant/bar it is reminiscent of the illegal speakeasy of days gone by. A very pleasant staff of waitresses, a classic and specialty menu of drinks, a fun place  to go have a cocktail and snack.  I had a Penicillin made with scoth and a few additional items. Good drink. Will be back on my next visit.

data.title: A true Speakeasy!
data.text: There are no signs nor placards to point you to this place...just like in the 1920's and 30's!!  The food is very good and service is fun.  Don't go looking for fancy drinks...IT"S A SPEAKEASY!  Whiskey, Rye, Gin and Vodka!  No umbrellas!!

data.title: Very cool atmosphere!
data.text:
On my last trip to NYC I missed an opportunity to visit a speakeasy, so when I discovered there was one underneath Crust in Chandler, I had to pay them a visit with my wife. 

Lit throughout with Edison bulbs, this place is a flashback to another era. Inside you will find a full size bar and several booths where you can sit down with friends to enjoy a fine cocktail. If you really feel the need to relax, you can also grab one of several couches, complete with coffee table and nearby bookshelves. This place is very cool! 

A cocktail menu lists all of The Ostrich's own signature drinks, which includes many of the classics. If you don't see anything that interests you, ask one of their more than capable bartenders to make you one of your own favorites. There are plenty of liquors to choose from. 

On this visit I tried two of my favorites: an Old Fashioned and a Manhattan. Both of these were made perfectly, but the Manhattan was amazing! They serve this drink up complete with a Luxardo cherry. If you've never had one if these before, think of them as the Cadillac of maraschino cherries. But don't eat it too soon - let it soak in the booze while you sip your drink and save it for the end. You can thank Brianna for that tip. She would be the awesome server that took care of us during our visit. 

There is a food menu available in case you get hungry. This comes from Crust, which is located upstairs. 

Prices here are definitely higher than your average bar - but we enjoyed the atmosphere enough that we are already planning a return visit. The noise level varies depending on which day of the week you stop by. When we were here on a Thursday, it was moderate to quiet. 

There is virtually no cellphone service inside The Ostrich, but to be fair, you are sitting inside a basement surrounded by concrete. Put your phone away, make some new friends and have a good time! 🍸🍷🍻

data.title: Great hideaway
data.text: This is a great place to have drinks and food if you can find it. Hidden beneath Crust Pizzeria lies a this speakeasy of sorts with a full bar and food from Crust Pizzeria. The Ostrich does become crowded soon after opening, but the staff seems to keep up. They do have an extensive drink menu and use top shelve and fresh ingredients.

data.title: Great atmosphere!
data.text: What a fun place to have a drink and be with friends! Its speakeasy feel was a welcome break from the typical bar setting. This is a must for anyone wanting a unique experience on a night out.

data.title: Loved the feel here,
data.text:
I was here as part of an event and found the unusual setting with an unusual history wonderful! 
Buffet food was available while I was there and this was very tasty and certainly hit the mark. The bar tender knew his products inside out AND backwards- his name is   Brandon Casey.
Sadly I do not live in the local otherwise I know this would become my local. 
I omitted one star as I saw no disability access.
PS, this place is haunted!! yey,
